column1: Voula (Greek: Βούλα) is a southern suburb of Athens and former municipality in East Attica
column2: Greece. Since the 2011 local government reform it is part of the municipality Vari-Voula-Vouliagmeni
column3: of which it is the seat and a municipal unit. The municipal unit has an area of 8.787 km2. Grigoris Konstantellos is the incumbent mayor
column4: elected for a second term at May 26
column6: for the unified municipality of Vari-Voula-Vouliagmeni.

column1: Voula is a southern suburb of Athens
column2: 16 km south of the city centre. It is located on the Saronic Gulf coast
column3: at the southwestern foot of the Hymettus mountain. Adjacent coast towns are Glyfada to the northwest and Vouliagmeni to the south. The Greek National Road 91 (Athens - Sounio) passes through Voula. One of the largest hospitals in the Athens conurbation
column5: lies in the northern part of Voula. It is served by the southern terminus of the Athens Tram lines 3 and 5
